c74object.name: bach.det
c74object.digest: Compute the determinant of a matrix
c74object.description:
Computes the determinant of the incoming matrix.
For non-square matrices, the product of the pivots is output.

outlet.digest: The determinant of the incoming matrix

method.name: bang
method.description: Outputs the determinant of the most recently input matrix.

method.name: llll
method.description:
The object outputs the determinant of the incoming matrix.
In the bach environment, a matrix is just a llll having depth two, whose first-level sublllls are the rows of the matrix. For instance the matrix (1 0 0) (0 1 0) (0 0 1) is the 3 by 3 identity matrix. A "good" matrix is supposed to be well formed, i.e. all its rows must have the same length. A matrix is square if the length of the rows (which is the number of columns) is the same as the number of rows.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

c74object.discussion:
The determinant of the matrix is computed by Gaussian elimination and then by taking the product of pivots.
In the bach environment, a matrix is just a llll having depth two, whose first-level sublllls are the rows of the matrix. For instance the matrix (1 0 0) (0 1 0) (0 0 1) is the 3 by 3 identity matrix. A "good" matrix is supposed to be well formed, i.e. all its rows must have the same length. A matrix is square if the length of the rows (which is the number of columns) is the same as the number of rows.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: The determinant of the incoming matrix.

entry.name: More details
entry.description:
The determinant of the matrix is computed by Gaussian elimination and then by taking the product of pivots.
In the bach environment, a matrix is just a llll having depth two, whose first-level sublllls are the rows of the matrix. For instance the matrix (1 0 0) (0 1 0) (0 0 1) is the 3 by 3 identity matrix. A "good" matrix is supposed to be well formed, i.e. all its rows must have the same length. A matrix is square if the length of the rows (which is the number of columns) is the same as the number of rows.

entry.name: Keywords
entry.description: determinant, matrix, calculate, compute, Gauss elimination.
